ETYMOLOGY: From Latin aequator ('equalizer'), derived from aequare ('to make equal'). Originally used in Medieval Latin as 'circulus aequator diei et noctis' (circle equalizing day and night).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An imaginary great circle around the Earth, equally distant from both the North and South Poles, dividing the Earth into the Northern and Southern Hemispheres.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 地球上的假想大圆，与南北两极距离相等，将地球分为北半球和南半球。 (即赤道)
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The country lies just south of the equator, experiencing a tropical climate year-round.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 该国位于赤道以南，全年气候为热带。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The great circle of any sphere or celestial body perpendicular to its axis of rotation.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 任何球体或天体上垂直于其自转轴的大圆。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The equatorial bulge is the difference between the equatorial and polar diameters of a planet.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 赤道隆起是行星赤道直径和极地直径之间的差异。
